full_title_en: Disease Activity Score-28 for Rheumatoid Arthritis with CRP (DAS28-CRP)
medium_description_en: Describes severity of rheumatoid arthritis using clinical and laboratory data, specifically CRP.
short_description_en: RA severity, specifically based on CRP.

seo.meta_description_en: The Disease Activity Score 28 (DAS-28-CRP) for Rheumatoid Arthritis with CRP describes severity of rheumatoid arthritis using clinical and laboratory data, specifically CRP.
seo.keywords_en: das28, das 28, das-28, das28 crp, das 28 crp, das-28 crp, disease activity crp, disease activity RA, disease activity rheumatoid, disease activity rheumatoid arthritis, disease activity RA

how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en:
• The DAS Scores indicate how active a patient’s rheumatoid arthritis (RA) is currently, and can be trended over time.
  • They were initially developed for comparing clinical trial results of RA drugs, but are now used as overall markers of disease activity.
  • Recently a “treat to target” approach has been recommended: that a DAS score be frequently calculated until a patient’s score suggests disease remission, or to a particular ESR or CRP level.
  • The DAS scores were simplified, previously using 44 joints for assessment, and now instead use 28.

Points to Keep In Mind:

  • There is some degree of inter-rater variability in assessing the DAS scores, as different raters may classify a joint as swollen or tender to different degrees.
  • The feet are not assessed in the DAS28 scores, since foot joint pains may be unrelated to RA activity (since we walk on our feet). Foot assessment, however, should still be considered in the patient’s broader gestalt, and foot complaints should obviously be considered and managed appropriately in RA patients.
how_to_use.why_use_en: Recently a “treat to target” approach has been recommended: that a DAS score be calculated at frequent intervals while therapies are being given, until a patient’s score suggests disease remission, or to a particular ESR or CRP level.

next_steps.advice_en: Refer to ACR guidelines for treatment of rheumatoid arthritis.

about.formula_en:
DAS28-CRP= (0.56*√(tender joint count) + 0.28*√(swollen joint count) + 0.36*ln(CRP, mg/L + 1) + 0.014*global health, cm*10 + 0.96)

Global health: Ask the patient to rate their current quality of life by making a mark on a visual analog scale:
about.more_info_en:
Score interpretation:

DAS28 Score Range Disease Severity
< 2.6 Remission
≥ 2.6 - < 3.2 Low
≥ 3.2 - ≤ 5.1 Moderate
> 5.1 High

creator_info.about_en: Jaap Fransen, MD, is a senior researcher in rheumatology and professor of clinical research at the Radboud University Medical Center Nijmegen, the Netherlands. His research focuses on improving prognostication and treatment for rheumatic diseases including rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis, gout and systemic sclerosis.
